memberdef.definition: final int jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getHistorySize
memberdef.name: getHistorySize

detaileddescription.para: Returns the history size that is the number of populations kept by history

memberdef.definition: final Pool<T> jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getPool
memberdef.name: getPool

detaileddescription.para: Returns the individuals pool used by populations
Sets the history size, that is the number of populations kept by history.

parameterdescription.para: the new number of history populations

memberdef.definition: final Population<T> jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getHistoryAt
memberdef.name: getHistoryAt

detaileddescription.para: Returns the history population at the specified generation. The pos value can be relative or absolute. If relative, it must be a negative number that specifies how many generations to go back in order to get the population. So that, 0 means the current generation, -1 means one generation back, -2 means two generations back, and so on. If positive, the generation index is absolute. If the population at the specified generation is not available, the method returns null.

simplesect.para: the history population, if available. Otherwise it returns null.

memberdef.definition: final Population<T> jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getInitialPopulation
memberdef.name: getInitialPopulation

detaileddescription.para: Returns the initial population. This is the population given as input to the genetic algorithm, thus it is not affected by the initial population randomization.

memberdef.definition: final Population<T> jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getCurrentPopulation
memberdef.name: getCurrentPopulation

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current population. This is the population given as input to the algorithm's body at the current generation. When the algorithm starts, it is a copy of the initial population, and it is eventually affected by the randomization process.

memberdef.definition: final Population<T> jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getNextPopulation
memberdef.name: getNextPopulation

detaileddescription.para: Returns the genetic algorithm next population. This is the population being processed by the algorithm's body at the current generation. It is the population that will be given as input to the algorithm's body sequence at the following generation.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.evolve
memberdef.name: evolve

detaileddescription.para: Evolves the algorithms by restarting the algorithm from the initial population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.evolve
memberdef.name: evolve

detaileddescription.para: Evolves the algorithms by resetting the initial population and restarting the algorithm.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.evolve
memberdef.name: evolve

detaileddescription.para: Evolves the algorithm until the termination condition or the generation limit is reached. Depending on the argument, the algorithm restarts or continues from the last population.

parameterdescription.para: if true, the initial population is reset; if false, the algorithm continues from the last population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.evaluatePopulation
memberdef.name: evaluatePopulation

detaileddescription.para: Evaluates the population. The method iterates the evaluation on each individual. Evalution is performed according to fullEvaluationForced

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.evaluatePopulation
memberdef.argsstring: (final Population< T > population, final boolean forced)
memberdef.name: evaluatePopulation

detaileddescription.para: Evaluates the population. The method iterates the evaluation on each individual. Evalution is performed according to flag

parameterdescription.para: the population to be evaluated forced if true, all individuals are evaluated.

detaileddescription.para: Evaluates a single individual. This evaluation of individuals is specifically related to the problem to solve. If the genetic algorithm's body has a Fitness, this method calls Fitness#evaluate(jenes.population.Individual) method, otherwise method requiring an implementation by the sublass.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.setRandomization
memberdef.name: setRandomization

detaileddescription.para: Sets the randomization rate to 0 or 1, according to the flag. By this method is possible to apply the randomization process to the whole population or not at all.

parameterdescription.para: if true the rate is set to 1, otherwise to 0.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the randomization rate. The randomization rate represents the percentage of individuals that will be randomized. The value should be within [0,1]. However the method automatically trims values outside the unary range, so that negative values are trimmed to 0 and values bigger than 1, are trimmed to 1. Therefore the method is consistent for any value.

parameterdescription.para: the randomization rate to use during the randomization phase

memberdef.definition: final double jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getRandomization
memberdef.name: getRandomization

detaileddescription.para: Provides the randomization rate, that is the percentage of individuals being randomized by the algorithm.

memberdef.definition: final int jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getGeneration
memberdef.name: getGeneration

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current generation counter

memberdef.definition: final int jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getGenerationLimit
memberdef.name: getGenerationLimit

detaileddescription.para: Returns the generation limit
Sets the generation limit
Adds a new stage at the genetic algorithm's body

memberdef.definition: final boolean jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.isBiggerBetter
memberdef.name: isBiggerBetter

detaileddescription.para: Says if the algorithm's body objective is set to maximize or minimize individual fitness.

simplesect.para: true is the body objective is to maximize the fitness false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Sets the algorithm's body objective to maximize (true) or minimize (false) the individual fitness. All stages belonging to the body sequence are recursevely set according to the flag.

parameterdescription.para: true to set the body to maximize the fitness, false to minimize

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current evaluation mode. By defualt it is false.
true, if evaluation is referred to the whole popuation.

Sets the evalaution mode.
flag
- true if evaluation is referred to the whole popuation. False if evaluation is only referred to unevaluated individuals. By default it is false.

memberdef.definition: final int jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getElitism
memberdef.name: getElitism

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of individuals considered for elitism by the genetic algorithm.
Sets the number of individuals considered for elitism by the genetic algorithm. If it is 0, elitism has no place in this algorithm.

memberdef.definition: final ElitismStrategy jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getElitismStrategy
memberdef.name: getElitismStrategy

detaileddescription.para: Returns the elitism strategy used by this genetic algorithm

Sets the elitism strategy to used by this genetic algorithm. This stratehy can be RANDOM or WORST: in the first case the random individuals will be replaced by the elite individuals; in the latter the algorithm will replace the worst individuals.

Sets the resize stragety. This is for advanced use. The genetic algorithm should have a need to resize an existing population, in particular to expand it. Expanding the population would eventually require to create new Individual. The resize strategy specifies the way to perform such a task. Possible strategies are:
ResizeStrategy#AUTO: entails the creation of new individuals, generally by cloning.
ResizeStrategy#EMPTY: expands the population, without creating new individuals.
ResizeStrategy#NONE: disables the automatic resize of populations.

memberdef.definition: final ResizeStrategy jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getResizeStrategy
memberdef.name: getResizeStrategy

detaileddescription.para: Returns the resize strategy used by this genetic algorithm.

memberdef.definition: final Sequence<T> jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.getBody
memberdef.name: getBody

detaileddescription.para: Returns the algorithm's body sequence.

memberdef.name: removeAlgorithmEventListener

simplesect.para: an object containing the algorithm statistics

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.updateStatistics
memberdef.name: updateStatistics

detaileddescription.para: Updates the algoritm statistics at the moment of invokation.

parameterdescription.para: the statistics object to be updated

memberdef.definition: final String jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.toString
memberdef.name: toString

detaileddescription.para: Provides the algorithm termination condition. By default it returns false as reaching the generation limit is the sole ending criterion Subclasses can override this method in order to provide a problem specific termination condition.

simplesect.para: true if the ga evolution reached the termination condition, false otherwise

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.start
memberdef.name: start

detaileddescription.para: Starts this genetic algorithm. This method performs the algorithm initialization and notifies the start and init events. It is automatically invoked by the method evolve(), thus it should not be explicity invoked.

parameterdescription.para: if true, the algorithm reset the initial population.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.stop
memberdef.name: stop

detaileddescription.para: Terminates the genetic algorithm, notifying the stop event to listeners. It is automatically invoked by the method evolve(), thus it should not be explicity invoked.
Invoked when a start ga event occurs. By default, no action is performed. Override this method to make the GeneticAlgorithm subclass able to be notfied of the start event.

parameterdescription.para: the start event time expressed in milliseconds

detaileddescription.para: Invoked when an init end ga event occurs. By default, no action is performed. Override this method to make the GeneticAlgorithm subclass able to be notfied of the init event.

parameterdescription.para: the init event time expressed in milliseconds

detaileddescription.para: Invoked when a stop event occurs. By default, no action is performed. Override this method to make the GeneticAlgorithm subclass able to be notfied of the stop event.

parameterdescription.para: the stop event time expressed in milliseconds

detaileddescription.para: Invoked when a generation ga end event occurs. By default, no action is performed. Override this method to make the GeneticAlgorithm subclass able to be notfied of the generation event.

parameterdescription.para: the generation event time expressed in milliseconds

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.randomizePopulation
memberdef.name: randomizePopulation

detaileddescription.para: Perform a population randomization, by itering on individuals. This process is generally useful to enrich the population diversity, necessary to the genetic algorithm for exploiting the search space, especially the initial population is created by cloning a sample individual.

The percentage of individuals to be randomized can be finely controlled by the randomization rate. This is useful in many problems where a dominant solution should be kept in the population, but still providing a random genetic variety. The randomization rate is controlled by the setRandomization(double) method.
This method is automatically invoked by the start(boolean) method, so no explicit invokation is required.

Performs an individual randomization. It is invoked by randomizePopulation(Population). By default randomization is delegated to the individual. In some problems, it would be useful to control the randomization process of individual. This is especially the case of when there are some constraints on genes in order to make the individual valid.

memberdef.definition: final void jenes.GeneticAlgorithm< T extends Chromosome >.applyElitism
memberdef.name: applyElitism

detaileddescription.para: Applies the elitism to the current population, according to the chosen strategy. This method is authomatically invoked by evolve(), and should not be explicitaly invoked.
This is the main class of JENES, providing the skeleton for implementing genetic algorithms.
A genetic algorithm can be implemented by providing a Fitness function. An alternative way (but deprecated) is to subclass GeneticAlgorithm and to overwrite the method evaluateIndividual(Individual).

The genetic algorithm body is made of a sequence of stages. Which stages and in which order to consider is left to the algorithm needs. Generally, the sequence is made of a selection operator, followed by a a crossover operator, and then by a mutation operator. This schema is implemented by jenes.algorithms.SimpleGA.
An example of code is provided below. First, the initial population has to be created.
A fitness function is implmented.
Then, the genetic algorithm is instanced.

para.preformatted: GeneticAlgorithm<BooleanChromosome> ga = new GeneticAlgorithm<BooleanChromosome>(fit, pop, GENERATION_LIMIT);

detaileddescription.para: In this example, we used an anonymous subclass, but other subclassing methods can be used. After, stages (operators in particular) are added to the algorithm's body.
Finally, the algorithm is executed.

A genetic algorithm processes a Population of Individuals. At each generation there are an input and output population. The reference to these populations can be respectively obtained by the methods getCurrentPopulation() and getNextPopulation(). Past populations are buffered in the algorithm's history. An history population can be retrieve by the method getHistoryAt(int). The reference to an history population is valid for the history length. After, populations are collected for reuse, so references to them are not anymore valid.

The genetic algorithm execution is invoked by the method evolve(). The algorithm execution passes through the following events:
Start: the algorithm is just created.
Init: internal structures, such as the population given as input at generation 0 and history, are initialized.
Generation: a generation has been just performed.
Stop: the algorithm terminates its executions.
Each of these events can be captured by AlgorithmEventListeners and GenerationEventListeners. They can also be caputured by the GeneticAlgorithm subclass, by overriding the methods onStart, onInit, onGeneration, and onStop. Capturing events is useful to collect statistics and to perform analyses. Evolution terminates when the maximum number of generations is reached. It is possible to terminate the execution on the basis of some condition (e.g. precision level, variance of population, ecc.) by overriding the method end().

GeneticAlgorithm include a support for elitism, that is best individuals at each generation are assured to be at the next generation. The number of elite individuals is set by the method setElitism(int). These individuals are substituted to some individuals to the processed population according to the following strategies:
ElitismStrategy#RANDOM: next population individuals are randomly selected and substituted by elite.
ElitismStrategy#WORST: next population worst individuals are substituted by elite.
The first strategy is more efficient as it does not require to order the population. The drawback is that individuals with a good fitness could be substituted by elite. The second strategy is slower, but assures that only worst individuals are substituted.
The genetic algorithm can be used for both maximizing or minimizing the fitness function. This can be accomplished by setting the fitness.
GeneticAlgorithm can process populations with a variable number of individuals at each generation.
GeneticAlgorithm performs by default an initial randomization of the population.

parameterdescription.para: The class of chromosomes to work with.
